Unfortunately this question is specific to declarations and access 
to clas=
ses in a specific project, which is always a headache.  So I 
am not comple=
tely sure why you can't get access to the theCart 
object.  One thing you m=
ight do is try to remove the object 
dependencies and just stick the necess=
ary code into the experiment 
directly.  But as you say, there is no need t=
o actually run the pole 
balancing loop in your project except for testing,=
 so I wouldn't put 
too much effort into it.

There is also a realtime game=
 loop in one of the other files that 
comes with rtNEAT that shows how a po=
pulation of onscreen agents can 
be all controlled at the same time by neur=
al networks that evolve 
even as the game loop has master control.

Sorry t=
hat I do not have a specific fix that I am aware of.

ken

hoogroups.com, "Jack Stone" <aoa_2012@...> wrote:
>

roup.

> Sha=
der Engine. One of the requirments of this project is quite a 
> strong AI =
Module.

n 
I 
> say NEAT had been used in a Torque game already, I thought it 
woul=
d 
> be fairly straight forward to use it.

> The rtNEAT code itself work=
s fine, and gives me what I'm assuming 
is 
> the correct output. However, =
because NEAT doenst process per tick, 
it 
> will freeze torque while it wo=
rks, and then resume torque. This

the help docs, and they say to look at 
pole2_realtime_loop
> (). 
> I am h=
aving difficulty however with supplying the arguments for 
the 
> realtime =
loop: "Population *pop, CartPole *thecart". They are 
created 
> in *pole2_=
test_realtime(), and passed to the pole2_realtime_loop,

 in the traditional implementation.
> 
> However, I need to call pole2_test=
realtime from my game loop, and 
so, 
> need a way to access the *pop and *=
thecart parameters. I have 
tried 
> declaring the Population and CartPole =
objects at the top of 
> experiments.cpp, as static, extern, trying to use =
a get and set 
> method, everything I can think of really, but I still cant=
 access 
the 
> *pop and *theCart objects from my realtime loop, so I cant =
call 
> pole2_realtimeloop() every tick.
> 
> Ultimately, I wont be using t=
he pole2 experiment in my game, but I 
> thought that would be a good place=
 to start, instead of jumping in 
at 
> the deep end so to speak. 
> 
> I'd=
 appreciate any help on this matter, thanks,
